resources.string: %s must control at least one character !
You need at least 2 different teams !
Do you want to end the game and go back to the main screen ?
Reduce your opponents hit points to 0
When you turn begins, choose an action for your character in order to either inflict damage to your enemies or to improve your stats.
%s stands proudly, knowing that justice is on his side.
%s will not give up. The fate of too many people is at stake !
%s gathers his courage and jumps into action.
%s is ready to strike. May his enemies shiver in fear …
The time for %s\'s revenge has come !
%s has the eye of the tiger, feels the thrill of the fight.
%s is pushing himself beyond his limits.
%s is not planning to go down that easily.
It\'s time for %s to show what he\'s capable of.
Will %s\'s next move turn the tide of the battle ?
The fight is finally over. %s is taking a well deserved rest …
%s\' heroic deeds will be passed on future generations.
This is the end for you !
You won\'t be able to get away this time !
Nobody will come to save you !
You will regret having challenged me !
You are no match for me !
You will be powerless against my move !
I will have my revenge against you all !
Time to go beyond my limits !
Ultimate Cat Battle is a turn-based fighting game featuring a cat, a penguin, and others.
You can play solo against the computer or with other players on the same device, up to 4 players.
To start a game, first select the number of players by clicking the appropriate button.
By default, each player has a single character assigned (including the computer in single-player mode).
In this screen, you can change the character allocation and even add new characters, up to 4. If there are more characters than players, you can also assign characters to the computer.
A player can control more than one character, however each player must control at least one (including the computer in single player mode).
Assign the character to another player by selecting the target player icon.
Change the player assigned to the character.
If you are done press the \'Confirm\' button. If you want to go back to the main screen press the \'Cancel\' button.
The purpose of this screen is to configure the power level of each player, allowing to fine-tune the difficulty.
Power levels will impact the initial hit points, hit rating and avoidance rating of the player\'s characters. For computer players, it will also impact how it will compute its moves.
Update the power level of a player by selecting the target power icon.
Change the power level of the player.
If you are done press the \'Confirm\' button. If you want to go back to the player selection screen press the \'Cancel\' button.

By default, each player is against all other players and belongs to his own team. You can however allow cooperative gameplay by assigning different players into the same team. Players on the same team win or lose together.

Each character controlled by the computer is considered as a dedicated player. You can\'t put human players and computer players into a same team (available teams are different between human players and computer players).
There are no restrictions regarding how many players can be in the same team as long as there are dispatched into at least 2 different teams.
Characters who belong to smaller teams (e.g.: 1 vs 3) will have their damage and hit points increased in order to balance the gameplay.
Assign the player to another team by selecting the target team icon.
Change the team assigned to the player.
If you are done press the \'Confirm\' button. If you want to go back to the power level selection screen press the \'Cancel\' button.
At the beginning of the game, each character is given a random delay (in time units). The character who has the lowest delay will play first.

Once a character hit points reaches 0, he will be out of combat. The game will end when only one team still has active characters (this team wins), or when only computer teams have active characters (computer wins).
Press \'Start game\' in order to start the next player\'s turn.

Player turn is based on how many units of time a player need in order to be able to act. Each move has a time cost which will apply a delay to the active player. If the delay is greater than the next player\'s, the turn of the current player will end.
The active player is displayed in the left part of the screen, along with his detailed statistics.
Information about other players is displayed in the right part of the screen :
In order to proceed, press \'Start Turn\'.
Hit points : Remaining stamina of the character. Lowered by enemy attacks. Once it reaches 0 the character is out of combat.
Available time : Remaining units of time before next player\'s turn.
Attack rating : A higher value increases damage dealt
Defense rating : A higher value decreases damage received
Hit rating : A higher value increases the success of attack moves
Avoidance rating : A higher value decreases the success of being hit by an opponent\'s attack move
Critical rating : A higher value increases the chance of critical hit. A critical attack move have its damage and effects duration increased by 50 %
Waiting time : Units of time before this character\'s next turn.
Active : This icon is displayed during this character\'s turn.

Your most important task is selecting your next move. There are two types of moves : attack moves and support moves. Attack moves (in red) inflicts damage to your opponents and can optionally affect them with negative status effects. Support moves (in green) modifies the stats of either yourself or your allies.
All moves have a time cost, which upon use is added to your character overall delay before its next move. If the cost is higher than your character remaining time, your character\'s turn will end.

Some moves have cooldown timers upon usage, which means that you will have to wait before being able to use them again. When a move is still on cooldown, its button is grayed out and the remaining time before being available is displayed.
Icons shared by all moves are :
Cost of the move (in time units)
Remaining cooldown time before the move is available again
Indicates that this move can target one character (opponent for attack, yourself or ally for support)
Indicates that this move target a group of characters (all opponents for attack).
Icons specific to attack moves are :
Base damage range of the attack before any stat modifiers are applied
Icons specific to support moves are :
Indication on which statistic will be the most buffed by this support move (Attack rating in this sample).
To select a move, press its associated button.
This screen gives a preview of the effects of your attack action and allows you to choose a target (if the action is single target).

You can select the target by pressing the icon representing the target character. It will also display the expected damage, hit chance and critical chance for this target. If the move is multi-target, pressing the character icon will only display the expected effects of the attack for this character.
If the move has any effects besides damage, it will also be displayed on this screen, including its probability and duration.
Displays the cost of the move in time units.
Displays the move cooldown time. If this icon does not appear, it means that this move has no cooldown.
In order to execute your move press \'Confirm\'. In order to return to the move selection screen press \'Cancel\'.
This screen gives a preview of the effects of your support action and allows you to choose a target.
You can select the target by pressing the icon representing the target character. It will also display the modified stats for the target and the duration of the effect.

Support moves have different effects based on whether you target yourself or an ally. When your target yourself, you will benefit from greater stat increases, but at the cost of a decrease in other stats. Do not forget that there is a lower cap of -50 % and an upper cap of + 50 % applied to the cumulated effects on a given stat.
The attack move is launched. Here goes nothing !
Press \'Next\' in order to see the results of the attack.
The support move is launched. Time for a power up !
Press \'Next\' in order to see the results of the support move.
This screen displays whether the attack has succeeded, was critical or just missed, along with the damage done and the applied status effects.
Press \'Next\' to continue. Depending on the situation, it may go to the move selection screen of the active character, switch to another character turn or end the game if all opponents are defeated.
This screen displays the statistics modified by the support move on the target.
Press \'Next\' to continue. Depending on the result, it may go to the move selection screen of the active character or switch to another character turn.
The game is over. Whether you won or lost, I hope that you enjoyed it !
Your only option now is to go back to the main screen by pressing the aptly named button. Time for a rematch ?
